tags.name: Introduction
tags.description: This application allows you to create, edit, delete and obtain channels for rendering in an application. Each channel obtained has a link to preview it in the front end of the application. It should be noted that this APP does not store the source content of the channels. It only stores in the database a URL of external servers, these external servers do not belong to this APP.

tags.name: App
tags.description: These are the general endpoints of the APP. Here you can find endpoints without any category.

tags.name: Docs
tags.description: These are the endpoints of the documentation. This documentation is the one that is being previewed right now, it should be noted that the returns of the answers are not specified in this category or section.

tags.name: Category
tags.description: These are the endpoints of the categories. It should be noted that the categories are how the APP channels are grouped.

tags.name: Type
tags.description: These are the endpoints of the types. It is worth mentioning that a type represents the main characteristic of the channel. For example if it is public or private.

tags.name: Source
tags.description: These are the endpoints of the APP sources. It should be noted that each channel has a source from which its link is taken. For example youtube or twitch.

tags.name: Channmel
tags.description: These are the APP Channels endpoints. These channels are the ones that will be used to render in the FrontEnd.
